title: Mother of murdered Becky Godden-Edwards has become close friends with DS Steve Fulcher
text:

The mother of murdered Becky Godden-Edwards has revealed she is now good friends with Detective Sergeant Steve Fulcher - the man who helped find her missing daughter's body.

Killer Chris Halliwell had confessed to killing 22-year-old Sian O'Callaghan, and in 2011 he led police to the place he left her body.

He then asked DS Fulcher, who was leading the investigation, if he "wanted another one".

(Image: Rex)

He also confessed to killing Becky at some time in 2002-2003, and told them where he had buried her body.

But because DS Fulcher had not reminded Halliwell of his Miranda rights or given him access to a solicitor, the case against him for Becky's murder fell apart, and DS Fulcher was sacked for gross misconduct.

This meant that the charge was dropped, and Becky's family never got justice.

But Becky's mum, Karen Edwards, says she does not blame DS Fulcher for his actions - and they have actually become close friends.

She told Chat magazine : "Since the trial, our family has kept in touch with Steve Fulcher and his wife Yvonne. They've actually become good friends of ours."

She added: "I never blamed him. He brought Becky back to me."

(Image: Godden Family / SWNS)

The taxi driver killer was eventually convicted of murdering Becky in 2016 - 13 years after killing her.

He was handed a whole life order for Becky's murder, meaning he is likely to die behind bars without ever being eligible for parole.

The case has now been serialised in an ITV drama, called A Confession.

(Image: Wiltshire Police/PA)

Judge Mrs Justice Cox ruled both of Halliwell's confessions were inadmissable as evidence because Fulcher had breached Police and Criminal Evidence Act guidelines.

According to the PACE rules, he should have cautioned the killer and given him access to a solicitor after discovering that Sian was dead.

An investigation by the Independent Police Complaints Commission in 2013 found the police officer had a case to answer for gross misconduct for ignoring force orders.

(Image: SWNS.com)

The following January Det Supt Fulcher was found guilty of gross misconduct and given a final disciplinary warning.

Fulcher made the decision to resign from Wiltshire Police force in May, 2014.

He has maintained that he made the decision not to escort Halliwell back to the police station because he felt it was important to take the opportunity to find Becky's body.

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

"That man is a hero. He brought Becky home — if he hadn’t done what he did, Halliwell would never have shown him where she was", said Karen.

"If it hadn’t been for DS Fulcher, Becky would still be in that field, and I would not know if my daughter was alive or dead."

Karen also stuck in for DS Fulcher at the time of the trial. She said: "It's really going to be such a waste of an extremely experienced detective who I know has solved so many crimes,"

(Image: ITV)

"Had he have followed the guidelines, then Becky would never have been found, she would have never have come into the equation and Sian would have still have been where he moved her to.

"No-one would have found Sian in a million years where they found her, where he dumped her body.

"It was Steve Fulcher's experience. OK, he bent rules - but he bent them for good reason."

(Image: Family handout/PA)

Sian’s mother Elaine Pickford is also grateful to DS Fulcher.

Speaking on To Catch A Serial Killer - With Trevor McDonald, Elaine said: “Steve did what I think any family member would want an officer to do for them.”

Today Halliwell remains locked up in the Category A HMP Long Lartin in Worcestershire. He has three children with his ex-wife Lisa.

*The final episode of A Confession airs tonight at 9pm on ITV
description: The mother of Becky Godden-Edwards does not resent the detective who caused the case against her daughter's murderer to fall apart, and they are in fact friends
